comments.comment: Investigating how I might automate setting up MySQL Slaves (Replication) with existing databases on the Master.  This would be from DB restoration, DB auto-repair, my.cnf changes before repair, and then post-repair, etc..  I'm wondering if Puppet is suited for this, some combination of tools, or something else.  Any hints or advice greatly appreciated.  I've obviously done this manually, and my user has the necessary access for it (some limited sudo, but not root).

data.description:
Join us for a talk on Puppet, and chat with other Puppet users!

Presentation by Klynton Jessup of Puppet Labs, Intro to Puppet & CI with Puppet! If you have a Puppet-related topic you're especially keen to know about, let us know in the comments.

Location: NCSU Engineering Building 2 (on Centennial Campus) Room 1021

Parking: Parking on Centennial Campus is free after 5pm, there are several parking decks adjacent to the Engineering Buildings.

comments.comment:
Guys,
Sorry but I am not going to be able to make it, my wife won some tickets to Of Monsters and Men concert on the same night.

I am hoping I can get a co-worker to go.  I am interested in seeing how others around are using puppet in there infrastructure.   I am trying to work out how to make the ENC, Puppet Code, Hiera Data simpler for our Ops teams to comprehend and use.

Hope we can schedule another meet up next month or months.

Thanks.
-Scott

member.bio: I am a systems programmer/developer for SAS and I have been working on building our puppet infrastructure for that past three years.
member.name: Scott Stonefield

comments.comment:
We have over 100 people on the list and only a few have RSVP'd for the meetup next week.  I know summer is kicking in but I look forward to meeting more people from this group and getting some ideas for making this a good use of everyone's time.

I'll start things off with some experiences I've shared at PuppetCamp on how to get from terminal-based configuration to a Hiera data model.  Please feel free to bring other topics to share.   And come hungry, there might be a few people eating a lot of pizza next Wed!
Hello World! You are welcome to ask us anything about puppet. :)

member.bio: Puppet Professional 2016 certified. 6 yrs of puppet experience.  Former Sr Sysadmin with Brookhaven National Lab. Moved to NC in late 2014. 1 yr with NCSU, now with Red Hat as Sr Software Engineer.
member.name: James Pryor

data.description:
Its time to revive the Raleigh PUG!  Please join us for pizza, introductions, and come with suggestions for what you would like to get out of the PUG.

If you have anything that you would like to share, please contact the organizers, ASAP.  We can have one 30 min presentation and several 5-10minute lightening talks just to share how people are using Puppet.
data.how_to_find_us: At the end of Gregson Dr, proceed to the right side of the building.  Signs will be posted at the entrance.

comments.comment:
Thank you to those who attended our July meeting.
Pizza was sponsored by TEKsystems and Jeremey Smith brought it to the meetup. Beer was sponsored by me, James.

Topics Discussed:
Node Classification and people shared our experiences with Foreman and Puppet Enterprise Console as the External Node Classifier, and even some who wrote their own external node classifer.

Puppet 3.x is probably going to End-Of-Life perhaps at the end of their calendar year since it has very little work:
https://tickets.puppetlabs.com/browse/PUP/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:roadmap-panel

My notes for puppet novices:
https://github.com/jjpryor/rpug-2016-07/blob/master/do_you_want_to_learn_puppet.md

Puppet blog & Puppet Twiter
https://puppet.com/blog/ 
https://twitter.com/puppetize

Ssome neat bits:
https://puppet.com/blog/debugging-hiera-redux

"Build your own Manageable Puppet Infrastructure Course"
https://www.udemy.com/manageable-puppet-infrastructure/?couponCode=TWEET2016

data.description:
Hi everyone! We are happy to invite you to the second meetup, this time at Red Hat Annex downtown in Raleigh.

Meeting specifics:
Puppet has offered a free-ticket to attend PuppetConf 2016, the conference in San Diego, CA. This free-ticket will be given away in a raffle at this meetup.

For this meeting we'll be discussing Node Classification. Do you classify your nodes in code? Or do you use an External Node Classifier: Foreman? Puppet Enterprise Console? Other? What methods have worked best for you?

This is the Google Street View of the entrance to the Red Hat Annex

We understand it might be difficult to get to downtown Raleigh due to traffic or other commitments, so we can soft-start at 6:30pm then begin at 7pm.

You should really RSVP since you will have to sign-in as a visitor at the Annex front-desk, and also so that we can target the right amount of pizzas.

Tentative Schedule
6:30pm: Arrive, socialize, Snacks and drinks,
7:00pm: Welcome & Eat Pizza
7:15pm: Introductions, Puppet topical announcements, Job Announcements
7:30pm: Open round table discussion on topics of your choice
7:45pm: Free PuppetConf ticket Raffle
7:50pm: Structured Talk/Presentation
8:15pm - 8:30pm: Mingle

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct.

If you have read this far, then I thank you for your patience

Meetup Poll: What puppet topics would you like to be discussed at RPUG meetups?

We are interested in knowing if you prefer certain topics to discuss at future meetings, so please check out the poll linked above. We are also looking for attendees that might have things to share. Do you have a particular workflow that works for you and might for others? Have you started writing your own puppet modules and have some tips? How do you classify your nodes? If so, then please reply to this meetup event.
data.how_to_find_us: The Red Hat Annex is not the Red Hat HQ. The Annex is on the same block as the HQ, but further east on East Davies Street. Parking at the Red Hat tower parking facility is free after 7pm.
data.name: 2nd Meeting. Free PuppetConf ticket! Topic: Node classification
data.plain_text_description:
Hi everyone! We are happy to invite you to the second meetup, this time at Red Hat Annex downtown in Raleigh.

Meeting specifics:
Puppet has offered a free-ticket to attend PuppetConf 2016, the conference in San Diego, CA. This (https://puppet.com/puppetconf)free-ticket will be given away in a raffle at this meetup.

For this meeting we'll be discussing Node Classification. Do you classify your nodes in code? Or do you use an External Node Classifier: Foreman? Puppet Enterprise Console? Other? What methods have worked best for you?

This is the Google Street View of the entrance to the Red Hat Annex (https://www.google.com/maps/uv?hl=en&pb=%211s0x89ac5f72f89fab65:0xea9ac5e349bb27f9%212m5%212m2%211i80%212i80%213m1%212i100%213m1%217e115%214s/maps/place/red%2Bhat%2Bannex/@35.7755125,-78.6369652,3a,75y,204.18h,90t/data%3D*213m4*211e1*213m2*211s_22vMMQXtk3g0S-RwlpgMA*212e0*214m2*213m1*211s0x0:0xea9ac5e349bb27f9%215sred+hat+annex+-+Google+Search&imagekey=%211e2%212s_22vMMQXtk3g0S-RwlpgMA&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiFufe1xZbNAhXBVhoKHTz0C6wQpx8IeTAK)

We understand it might be difficult to get to downtown Raleigh due to traffic or other commitments, so we can soft-start at 6:30pm then begin at 7pm.

You should really RSVP since you will have to sign-in as a visitor at the Annex front-desk, and also so that we can target the right amount of pizzas.

Tentative Schedule
6:30pm: Arrive, socialize, Snacks and drinks,
7:00pm: Welcome & Eat Pizza
7:15pm: Introductions, Puppet topical announcements, Job Announcements
7:30pm: Open round table discussion on topics of your choice
7:45pm: Free PuppetConf ticket Raffle
7:50pm: Structured Talk/Presentation
8:15pm - 8:30pm: Mingle

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct. (https://docs.puppet.com/community/community_guidelines.html)

If you have read this far, then I thank you for your patience http://img2.meetupstatic.com/img/1723755200050492932723/smileys/biggrin.gif

Meetup Poll: What puppet topics would you like to be discussed at RPUG meetups? (http://www.meetup.com/Raleigh-Puppet-User-Group/polls/1227064/)

We are interested in knowing if you prefer certain topics to discuss at future meetings, so please check out the poll linked above. We are also looking for attendees that might have things to share. Do you have a particular workflow that works for you and might for others? Have you started writing your own puppet modules and have some tips? How do you classify your nodes? If so, then please reply to this meetup event.

data.description:
Hello Triangle Puppet people. We are happy to invite you to the August meetup  at Arista Networks in Cary.

Please RSVP so that we can target the right amount of pizza and beer.


Meeting topics:
+ Our personal coding workflow (shell, git, code validation and style checking)
+ Red Hatters Eric Helms and Justin Sherrill will be giving a demo of The Foreman which is now 7 years old, and recently released  version 1.12 which has support for puppet 4.x.


The Foreman allows you to:
    Provision from anywhere
      Bare metal, Amazon EC2, Google Compute Engine, OpenStack, Libvirt, oVirt, VMware, and many other providers allow you to manage a hybrid cloud through Foreman.

    Manage Configuration
      An external node classifier, hiera-like parameters, and reports monitoring for Puppet, Salt and Chef are included. Completely ready to tweak host groups in your data center.

    Monitor hosts
      Foreman reports will tell you exactly what happened in your nodes, and alert you when things go awry. See in your dashboard which hosts are healthy, and which ones are outdated.

Meetup Poll: What puppet topics would you like to be discussed at RPUG meetups?

We are interested in knowing if you prefer certain topics to discuss at future meetings, so please check out the poll linked above. We are also looking for attendees that might have things to share. Do you have a particular workflow that works for you and might for others? Have you started writing your own puppet modules and have some tips? How do you classify your nodes? If so, then please reply to this meetup event.

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct.
data.how_to_find_us: Follow Gregson Dr to the end, then circle to the right side of the building to park.  You should see Suite 150 Arista on the sign near the entrance.  Upon entering, take the first door on the left for suite 150.
data.name: August Meeting. Demo of The Foreman. Discuss personal coding workflow.
data.plain_text_description:
Hello Triangle Puppet people. We are happy to invite you to the August meetup at Arista Networks in Cary.

Please RSVP so that we can target the right amount of pizza and beer.

Meeting topics:
+ Our personal coding workflow (shell, git, code validation and style checking)
+ Red Hatters Eric Helms and Justin Sherrill will be giving a demo of The Foreman (https://theforeman.org/) which is now 7 years old, and recently released version 1.12 which has support for puppet 4.x.

The Foreman allows you to:
Provision from anywhere
Bare metal, Amazon EC2, Google Compute Engine, OpenStack, Libvirt, oVirt, VMware, and many other providers allow you to manage a hybrid cloud through Foreman.

Manage Configuration
An external node classifier, hiera-like parameters, and reports monitoring for Puppet, Salt and Chef are included. Completely ready to tweak host groups in your data center.

Monitor hosts
Foreman reports will tell you exactly what happened in your nodes, and alert you when things go awry. See in your dashboard which hosts are healthy, and which ones are outdated.

Meetup Poll: What puppet topics would you like to be discussed at RPUG meetups? (http://www.meetup.com/Raleigh-Puppet-User-Group/polls/1227064/)

We are interested in knowing if you prefer certain topics to discuss at future meetings, so please check out the poll linked above. We are also looking for attendees that might have things to share. Do you have a particular workflow that works for you and might for others? Have you started writing your own puppet modules and have some tips? How do you classify your nodes? If so, then please reply to this meetup event.

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct. (https://docs.puppet.com/community/community_guidelines.html)

member.name: Wes Emerson

comments.comment: Slides: http://www.slideshare.net/JereJulian/custom-facts-raleigh-puppet-user-group-2016

FYI, there may be vehicle traffic around the Red Hat Tower due to the utility work at the intersection of South and Blount Streets. South-bound Blount Street is closed beyond Lenoir Street.  This makes for heavy traffic and congestion, especially during rush hour.

member.bio: Puppet Professional 2016 certified. 6 yrs of puppet experience.  Former Sr Sysadmin with Brookhaven National Lab. Moved to NC in late 2014. 1 yr with NCSU, now with Red Hat as Sr Software Engineer.
member.name: James Pryor

comments.comment: Can we park in the RH structure, or should we look for street parking?

replies.comment: I am not certain, but street parking if you can find it, should be free after 5pm. Parking at RH Tower is actually a publicly accessible paid-parking lot handled by an outside company on behalf of the City of Raleigh. Parking is free after 7pm and if I recall correctly is about a $1 an hour. I think if you park at 6:30pm it should be $1.

member.bio: Puppet Professional 2016 certified. 6 yrs of puppet experience.  Former Sr Sysadmin with Brookhaven National Lab. Moved to NC in late 2014. 1 yr with NCSU, now with Red Hat as Sr Software Engineer.
member.name: James Pryor

data.description:
Hi everyone! We are happy to invite you to the September meetup, at Red Hat Annex downtown in Raleigh.

Meeting specifics:
We'll be discussing Custom Facts with facter and how you can use them to get specific and perhaps finer-grained fact-data than general facts.



Google Maps link entrance to the Red Hat Annex.  And Street View of the entrance to the Annex http://imgur.com/a/9up2V


We understand it might be difficult to get to downtown Raleigh due to traffic or other commitments, so we can soft-start at 6:30pm then begin at 7pm.

You should really RSVP since you will have to sign-in as a visitor at the Annex front-desk, and also so that we can target the right amount of pizzas.

Tentative Schedule
6:30pm: Arrive, socialize, Snacks and drinks,
7:00pm: Welcome & Eat Pizza , Introductions & announcements
7:15pm: Custom Facts
8:00pm: Open discussion

Meetup Poll: What puppet topics would you like to be discussed at RPUG meetups?

We are interested in knowing if you prefer certain topics to discuss at future meetings, so please check out the poll linked above. We are also looking for attendees that might have things to share. Do you have a particular workflow that works for you and might for others? Have you started writing your own puppet modules and have some tips? How do you classify your nodes? If so, then please reply to this meetup event.

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct.
data.how_to_find_us: The Red Hat Annex is not the Red Hat HQ. The Annex is on the same block as the HQ, but further east on East Davies Street. Parking at the Red Hat tower parking facility is free after 7pm.
data.name: September meeting. Custom facts. Pizza & beer
data.plain_text_description:
Hi everyone! We are happy to invite you to the September meetup, at Red Hat Annex downtown in Raleigh.

Meeting specifics:
We'll be discussing Custom Facts with facter and how you can use them to get specific and perhaps finer-grained fact-data than general facts.

Google Maps link entrance to the Red Hat Annex. (https://www.google.com/maps/uv?hl=en&pb=%211s0x89ac5f72f89fab65:0xea9ac5e349bb27f9%212m5%212m2%211i80%212i80%213m1%212i100%213m1%217e115%214s/maps/place/red%2Bhat%2Bannex/@35.7755125,-78.6369652,3a,75y,204.18h,90t/data%3D*213m4*211e1*213m2*211s_22vMMQXtk3g0S-RwlpgMA*212e0*214m2*213m1*211s0x0:0xea9ac5e349bb27f9%215sred+hat+annex+-+Google+Search&imagekey=%211e2%212s_22vMMQXtk3g0S-RwlpgMA&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiFufe1xZbNAhXBVhoKHTz0C6wQpx8IeTAK) And Street View of the entrance to the Annex http://imgur.com/a/9up2V (http://imgur.com/a/9up2V)

We understand it might be difficult to get to downtown Raleigh due to traffic or other commitments, so we can soft-start at 6:30pm then begin at 7pm.

You should really RSVP since you will have to sign-in as a visitor at the Annex front-desk, and also so that we can target the right amount of pizzas.

Tentative Schedule
6:30pm: Arrive, socialize, Snacks and drinks,
7:00pm: Welcome & Eat Pizza , Introductions & announcements
7:15pm: Custom Facts
8:00pm: Open discussion

Meetup Poll: What puppet topics would you like to be discussed at RPUG meetups? (http://www.meetup.com/Raleigh-Puppet-User-Group/polls/1227064/)

We are interested in knowing if you prefer certain topics to discuss at future meetings, so please check out the poll linked above. We are also looking for attendees that might have things to share. Do you have a particular workflow that works for you and might for others? Have you started writing your own puppet modules and have some tips? How do you classify your nodes? If so, then please reply to this meetup event.

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct. (https://docs.puppet.com/community/community_guidelines.html)

https://github.com/jerej/rpug-2016-11
True.  The PUG meetup should be far friendlier, though!
Friendly warning - there are two political rallies in the Raleigh/Durham area today around the time of the meeting. Plan for traffic.

data.description:
Hi everyone! We are happy to invite you to the November meeting, at Arista Networks in Cary, NC.

Meeting specifics:
Jere and James were at PuppetConf in San Diego, and we'll be discussing the things we learned, people we met, and potential future meeting topics. Also giving away some conference swag.



Tentative Schedule
6:30pm: Arrive, socialize, Snacks and drinks, Eat Pizza
7:00pm: Introductions & announcements
7:05pm: Take-away's from PuppetConf

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct.
data.how_to_find_us: Look for the signs that indicate the User Group Meetup.

data.description:
Hi everyone! We are happy to invite you to the December meetup, at Red Hat Annex downtown in Raleigh. Google Maps link entrance to the Red Hat Annex.  And Street View of the entrance to the Annex http://imgur.com/a/9up2V


Meeting topics:
Chris will be presenting about High Availability in puppet.


There will be a <a>BoF Q&A</a> with some of The Foreman developers: Marek Hulan, Daniel Lobato Garcia, and Ohad Levy.

We'll be raffling away a physical copy of The DevOps Handbook by Gene Kim, Jez Humble, Patrick Debois, and John Willis.


Tentative Schedule
6:30pm: Arrive, socialize, Snacks & drinks, Pizza and Beer
7:00pm: Introductions & announcements
7:05pm: Presentation about HA in Puppet
7:30pm: Break
7:40pm: Foreman BoF Q&A
8:10pm: Book Raffle


We understand it might be difficult to get to downtown Raleigh due to traffic or other commitments, so we soft-start at 6:30pm then really begin at 7pm.

Please RSVP since you will have to sign-in as a visitor at the Annex front-desk, and also so that we can target the right amount of pizzas.

Parking at The Red Hat Tower parking deck:
The actual name is the City Center Deck and the street address is 429 S. Wilmington Street, Raleigh, NC 27601. You may choose to park here, but be aware Red Hat does not manage this deck. It is a City of Raleigh public parking deck and they can ticket and tow.

Please note that the parking deck has two entrances. The Wilmington Street entrance is closer to the building, however this entrance is most easily accessed by those arriving from the south. The S Blount Street entrance is part of an attached deck and is most easily accessed by those arriving from the north.

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct.
data.how_to_find_us: The Red Hat Annex is not the Red Hat HQ. The Annex is on the same block as the HQ, but further east on East Davies Street. Parking at the Red Hat tower parking deck (real name  City Center Deck)is free after 7pm.
data.name: High Availability in puppet. Foreman Q&A with devs. DevOps Handbook raffle.
data.plain_text_description:
Hi everyone! We are happy to invite you to the December meetup, at Red Hat Annex downtown in Raleigh. Google Maps link entrance to the Red Hat Annex. (https://www.google.com/maps/uv?hl=en&pb=%211s0x89ac5f72f89fab65:0xea9ac5e349bb27f9%212m5%212m2%211i80%212i80%213m1%212i100%213m1%217e115%214s/maps/place/red%2Bhat%2Bannex/@35.7755125,-78.6369652,3a,75y,204.18h,90t/data%3D*213m4*211e1*213m2*211s_22vMMQXtk3g0S-RwlpgMA*212e0*214m2*213m1*211s0x0:0xea9ac5e349bb27f9%215sred+hat+annex+-+Google+Search&imagekey=%211e2%212s_22vMMQXtk3g0S-RwlpgMA&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiFufe1xZbNAhXBVhoKHTz0C6wQpx8IeTAK) And Street View of the entrance to the Annex http://imgur.com/a/9up2V (http://imgur.com/a/9up2V)

Meeting topics:
Chris will be presenting about High Availability in puppet.

There will be a BoF Q&A with some of The Foreman (https://theforeman.org/)developers: Marek Hulan, Daniel Lobato Garcia, and Ohad Levy.

We'll be raffling away a physical copy of The DevOps Handbook by Gene Kim, Jez Humble, Patrick Debois, and John Willis (http://itrevolution.com/devops-handbook).

Tentative Schedule
6:30pm: Arrive, socialize, Snacks & drinks, Pizza and Beer
7:00pm: Introductions & announcements
7:05pm: Presentation about HA in Puppet
7:30pm: Break
7:40pm: Foreman BoF Q&A
8:10pm: Book Raffle

We understand it might be difficult to get to downtown Raleigh due to traffic or other commitments, so we soft-start at 6:30pm then really begin at 7pm.

Please RSVP since you will have to sign-in as a visitor at the Annex front-desk, and also so that we can target the right amount of pizzas.

Parking at The Red Hat Tower parking deck:
The actual name is the City Center Deck (http://www.godowntownraleigh.com/go/city-center-parking-deck1) and the street address is 429 S. Wilmington Street, Raleigh, NC 27601. You may choose to park here, but be aware Red Hat does not manage this deck. It is a City of Raleigh public parking deck and they can ticket and tow.

Please note that the parking deck has two entrances. The Wilmington Street entrance is closer to the building, however this entrance is most easily accessed by those arriving from the south. The S Blount Street entrance is part of an attached deck and is most easily accessed by those arriving from the north.

This Puppet User group adheres to the following Code of Conduct. (https://docs.puppet.com/community/community_guidelines.html)
